org.eclipse.californium.core

Class CoapServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.californium.core.CoapServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ServerInterface

    public class CoapServer
extends Object
implements ServerInterface
    An execution environment for CoAP Resources. A server hosts a tree of Resources which are exposed to clients by means of one or more Endpoints which are bound to a network interface. A server can be started and stopped. When the server stops the endpoint frees the port it is listening on, but keeps the executors running to resume.

    The following code snippet provides an example of a server with a resource that responds with a "hello world" to any incoming GET request. 

       CoapServer server = new CoapServer(port);
   server.add(new CoapResource("hello-world") {
           public void handleGET(CoapExchange exchange) {
                 exchange.respond(ResponseCode.CONTENT, "hello world");
           }
   });
   server.start();
    The following figure shows the server's basic architecture. 
     +------------------------------------- CoapServer --------------------------------------+
 |                                                                                       |
 |                               +-----------------------+                               |
 |                               |    MessageDeliverer   +--> (Resource Tree)            |
 |                               +---------A-A-A---------+                               |
 |                                         | | |                                         |
 |                                         | | |                                         |
 |                 .-------->>>------------' | '--------<<<------------.                 |
 |                /                          |                          \                |
 |               |                           |                           |               |
 |             * A                         * A                         * A               |
 | +-----------------------+   +-----------------------+   +-----------------------+     |
 | |        Endpoint       |   |        Endpoint       |   |      Endpoint         |     |
 | +-----------------------+   +-----------------------+   +-----------------------+     |
 +------------v-A--------------------------v-A-------------------------v-A---------------+
              v A                          v A                         v A            
              v A                          v A                         v A         
           (Network)                    (Network)                   (Network)
    See Also:
    MessageDeliverer, Endpoint

    • Constructor Detail

      • CoapServer

        public CoapServer()
        Constructs a default server. The server starts after the method start() is called. If a server starts and has no specific ports assigned, it will bind to CoAp's default port 5683.

      • CoapServer

        public CoapServer(int... ports)
        Constructs a server that listens to the specified port(s) after method start() is called.
        Parameters:
        ports - the ports to bind to

      • CoapServer

        public CoapServer(NetworkConfig config,
          int... ports)
        Constructs a server with the specified configuration that listens to the specified ports after method start() is called.
        Parameters:
        config - the configuration, if null the configuration returned by NetworkConfig.getStandard() is used.
        ports - the ports to bind to

    • Method Detail

      • setExecutor

        public void setExecutor(ScheduledExecutorService executor)
        Sets the executor service to use for running tasks in the protocol stage.
        Parameters:
        executor - The thread pool to use.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this server is running.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the server by starting all endpoints this server is assigned to. Each endpoint binds to its port. If no endpoint is assigned to the server, an endpoint is started on the port defined in the config.
        Specified by:
        start in interface ServerInterface

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the server, i.e., unbinds it from all ports. Frees as much system resources as possible to still be able to be re-started with the previous binds.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface ServerInterface

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroys the server, i.e., unbinds from all ports and frees all system resources.
        Specified by:
        destroy in interface ServerInterface

      • setMessageDeliverer

        public void setMessageDeliverer(MessageDeliverer deliverer)
        Sets the message deliverer.
        Parameters:
        deliverer - the new message deliverer

      • getMessageDeliverer

        public MessageDeliverer getMessageDeliverer()
        Gets the message deliverer.
        Returns:
        the message deliverer

      • addEndpoint

        public void addEndpoint(Endpoint endpoint)
        Adds an Endpoint to the server. WARNING: It automatically configures the default executor of the server. Endpoints that should use their own executor (e.g., to prioritize or balance request handling) either set it afterwards before starting the server or override the setExecutor() method of the special Endpoint.
        Specified by:
        addEndpoint in interface ServerInterface
        Parameters:
        endpoint - the endpoint to add

      • getEndpoints

        public List<Endpoint> getEndpoints()
        Gets the list of endpoints this server is connected to.
        Specified by:
        getEndpoints in interface ServerInterface
        Returns:
        the endpoints
